en.latex:
\(A.\)
The graph is an upside down parabola shifted to the right. q is not a y- intercept and (p;q) is the maximum point of the graph.

en.latex:
The graph of \( g(x) = 3^x - 3 \) is the transformation of the graph \( f(x) = (\frac{1}{3})^x + 2 \) .
Describe this transformation in words.
en.html:
The graph of \( g(x) = 3^x - 3 \) is the transformation of the graph \( f(x) = (\frac{1}{3})^x + 2 \) .
Describe this transformation in words.

en.latex: Determine the coordinates \( T \) , the turning point of \( f(x) \) .
en.html: Determine the coordinates \( T \) , the turning point of \( f(x) \) .

en.latex: Determine the values of \( m \) and \( c \) .
en.html: Determine the values of \( m \) and \( c \) .

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&(3 ;-1) \quad(4 ; 0) \\
m&=\frac{-1-0}{3-4} \\
&=\frac{-1}{-1} \\
&=1 \\
&\therefore y=1 x+c \\
&\text { sub }(4 ; 0) \\
0&=1(4)+c \\
-4&=c \\
\therefore \quad y&=1 x-4
\end{aligned} 
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&(3 ;-1) \quad(4 ; 0) \\
m&=\frac{-1-0}{3-4} \\
&=\frac{-1}{-1} \\
&=1 \\
&\therefore y=1 x+c \\
&\text { sub }(4 ; 0) \\
0&=1(4)+c \\
-4&=c \\
\therefore \quad y&=1 x-4
\end{aligned} 
$$

af.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&(3 ;-1) \quad(4 ; 0) \\
m&=\frac{-1-0}{3-4} \\
&=\frac{-1}{-1} \\
&=1 \\
&\therefore y=1 x+c \\
&\text { sub }(4 ; 0) \\
0&=1(4)+c \\
-4&=c \\
\therefore \quad y&=1 x-4
\end{aligned} 
$$
af.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&(3 ;-1) \quad(4 ; 0) \\
m&=\frac{-1-0}{3-4} \\
&=\frac{-1}{-1} \\
&=1 \\
&\therefore y=1 x+c \\
&\text { sub }(4 ; 0) \\
0&=1(4)+c \\
-4&=c \\
\therefore \quad y&=1 x-4
\end{aligned} 
$$

en.latex: Determine the equation \( k(x) \) , if \( k(x) \) is a reflection of \( f(x) \) in the \( y \) -axis and then moved \( 2 \) units up.
en.html: Determine the equation \( k(x) \) , if \( k(x) \) is a reflection of \( f(x) \) in the \( y \) -axis and then moved \( 2 \) units up.

en.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text { Reflect in y-axis } \\
\qquad y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-5 \\
&\text { Move } 2 \text { up } \\
y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-3 \\
\therefore y&=\frac{-2}{-(x-3)}-3 \\
y&=\frac{2}{x-3}-3
\end{aligned} 
$$
en.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text { Reflect in y-axis } \\
\qquad y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-5 \\
&\text { Move } 2 \text { up } \\
y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-3 \\
\therefore y&=\frac{-2}{-(x-3)}-3 \\
y&=\frac{2}{x-3}-3
\end{aligned} 
$$

af.latex:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text { Reflect in y-axis } \\
\qquad y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-5 \\
&\text { Move } 2 \text { up } \\
y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-3 \\
\therefore y&=\frac{-2}{-(x-3)}-3 \\
y&=\frac{2}{x-3}-3
\end{aligned} 
$$
af.html:
$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text { Reflect in y-axis } \\
\qquad y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-5 \\
&\text { Move } 2 \text { up } \\
y&=\frac{-2}{-x+3}-3 \\
\therefore y&=\frac{-2}{-(x-3)}-3 \\
y&=\frac{2}{x-3}-3
\end{aligned} 
$$
